video.title: Angular Tutorial for Beginners - Web Framework with Typescript Course
video.description:
Learn the basics of Angular in this full course for beginners. Angular is a TypeScript-based free and open-source web application framework created by Google.

✏️ Slobodan Gajic created this course. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBu5ulO4d-d47lAVybpRTkw

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:05:26) Components
⌨️ (0:08:56) Lifecycle hooks
⌨️ (0:11:21) Text interpolation
⌨️ (0:13:31) Components Communication
⌨️ (0:19:01) Component Styles
⌨️ (0:23:36) Ng-Content
⌨️ (0:26:31) Template Statements
⌨️ (0:28:49) Pipes
⌨️ (0:32:22) Property Binding
⌨️ (0:34:56) Attribute, Class & Style
⌨️ (0:39:16) Event Binding
⌨️ (0:41:36) Two-way Binding
⌨️ (0:47:57) Directives
⌨️ (0:52:52) Attribute directives
⌨️ (0:56:36) Structural directives
⌨️ (1:01:15) Dependency Injection
⌨️ (1:04:14) Routing
⌨️ (1:13:19) Template-Driven Form
⌨️ (1:20:26) Reactive Forms
⌨️ (1:26:04) Form Validation
⌨️ (1:30:57) HTTP Client

⭐️ Video Resources ⭐️
🔗 Learn more about Pips: https://angular.io/guide/pipes
🔗 Cocktail API endpoint: www.thecocktaildb.com/api/json/v1/1/search.php?f=a
🔗 LoR API endpoint: https://the-one-api.dev/v2/movie
🔗 LoR API docs: https://the-one-api.dev/documentation

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 AppWrite

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Rafie Gilang
topLevelComment.text:
The context of beginner here can be misleading. IMO to understand this video, you need to at least handle a project using typescript + other framework (react, vue, svelte). And you still need to read angular documentation after watching this.

But If you use this video as quick refresher, this video is really good one.

topLevelComment.author: Curpop
topLevelComment.text: FYI at 15:01 there needs to be a ! following the  childMessage input. Here is that line  @Input() childMessage!: string; Hope this helps!

replies.author: JustValyk
replies.text:
Lately I've been doing this A LOT since it's the only solution I found at google, since putting an | undefined would bring me some errors sometimes... but I'm not even knowing how this is called so I can't investigate about it, do you know WHY do I need to do this, and why some people doesn't even if I'm doing the same as them?
Does it have any consecuences? And in short, what is that ! for that doesn't bring problems like the | undefined and how could I avoid having to use it all the time?

Sorry if it was too long and too much questions, but I'm just doing it because I know I need to, and not because I know why :s

topLevelComment.author: Sleek Silk
topLevelComment.text:
18:35  I'm getting an error  "Member 'child' implicitly has an 'any' type"

Please help, how do I resolve this

replies.author: Sleek Silk
replies.text: @Rupesh Ghimire thank you. I'd try it out

replies.author: Rupesh Ghimire
replies.text:
Use this: @ViewChild(ChildComponent) child!: { message: any; };

Also, don't forget to include parent component tag in app html template and child component tag in parent html template.

topLevelComment.author: Bariatric Friendly Cooking
topLevelComment.text: Thanks!

replies.author: Code with Sloba
replies.text: Wow thanks! I'm glad you liked it. Feel free to check my channel

topLevelComment.author: Horus Of Oz
topLevelComment.text: At the end of the Lifecycle Hooks section, I get a compile error due to no type being set for intervalSub. This can be resolved by setting type to any but my understanding is any should always be avoided. Can you advise what type should be set here?

replies.author: Lefos G
replies.text:
i just added "noImplicitAny": false in tsconfig.json

it may not be a good practise to do that, but it worked.

replies.author: THINH VO
replies.text: @Horus Of Oz Thank for this, I was getting confused by the videos, the Angular.io is easy to understand for me

replies.author: Jason Dunken
replies.text: You can do it like this: intervalSub: ReturnType<typeof setInterval>

replies.author: bear.
replies.text: @Horus Of Oz I will do that, thank you.

replies.author: Horus Of Oz
replies.text: @bear. In that case I highly recommend the Mozilla tutorials first. Check out the MDN (not MSN) and you'll find comprehensive tutorials for HTML, CSS and JS. Their front end developer course I'd the best of its kind that I've found.

topLevelComment.author: Jill Valentine
topLevelComment.text: I read an article yesterday that said AngularJS and AngularTS (basically called Angular) are two very different things. This guy said that the version of Angular before Angular 2 was called AngularJS. I'm confused. How does one understand which one to study?

replies.author: Code with Sloba
replies.text:
Well those are the same statements.

There was AngularJs which is first version. Then they released Angular 2 and every other version is referred as Angular

replies.author: Suhail Khan
replies.text: Angularjs (Angular 1) is basically deprecated now. Only people who have projects in Angular js are using angular js(version 1) if you have to start new go for angular (2+) currently Angular 12 . Angular 12 is basically Angular 2 with additional/modified features. Core concepts are same. But AngularJS(angular 1) is totally different . So go for Angular 12(Angualr 2+)
